title: Ticket #1751: DAGMan fails on two-deep splices in a SOAR workflow
description:
Bill has a SOAR workflow in which he tried to use two-deep splices in combination with DIR settings, and DAGMan fails when trying to parse this: 

  11/03 08:38:03 movieruns.dag (line 5): Missing Parent Job names

When the SPLICE keywords were changed to SUBDAG EXTERNAL, everything worked, so it's definitely something going wrong with SPLICE as opposed to a typo or something like that.
remarks:
2010-Nov-03 10:16:48 by wenger:
Okay, I've tracked this down some -- it turns out that the failure has nothing to do with the DIR specifications. The problem is that the first-level splice DAG has only another splice in it, with no actual JOB nodes. If you add a JOB node to that splice DAG, everything works.

I think that maybe fixing this should include the addition of the "socket nodes" we've talked about that would enable splices to have PRE and POST scripts. It seems like if we added the socket nodes, it would pretty much automatically fix this problem.

2010-Nov-03 12:01:16 by wenger:
Added the job_dagman_splice-P test which tests this bug (currently commented out until we actually fix the problem).

2010-Nov-04 11:35:40 by wenger:
Also see the new job_dagman_splice-Q test -- if the splice is the child rather than the parent, DAGMan core dumps...

2011-Mar-30 10:59:19 by psilord:
Stalled due to starvation.

2011-Nov-30 16:11:27 by wenger:
I'm assigning this to Nathan -- to be worked on after the brain dump from Pete tomorrow.

2011-Dec-06 09:49:05 by nwp:
Looking at the code to deal with this, I think it should be rewritten so that splices and nodes use C++ inheritance to treat nodes and splices symmetrically in the code. But that is probably too ambitious a fix at this point.

2011-Dec-09 15:15:25 by wenger:
Okay, I've looked at this and it all looks good. Nathan -- you can merge this to V6-branch now.

2011-Dec-09 16:23:17 by nwp:
Version history is complete, so I am resolving this ticket.
